title.narrative: 5. COMMUNICATION FOR BEHAVIOR AND SOCIAL NORMS CHANGES

description.narrative: by 2022, Families, communities, children and adolescents (girls/boys) in the target areas, and in society in general, are better informed and equipped to abandon FGM/C, child marriage and violence, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention Of Harmful Practice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: by 2022, Families, communities, children and adolescents (girls/boys) in the target areas, and in society in general, are betterinformed and equipped to abandon FGM/C, child marriage and violence

description.narrative: Community participation and engagement have been the basis of strategies to encourage the involvement of community leaders in the promotion of social norms favorable to children&39;s rights and the sensitization of individuals, families and communities on matters relating to the promotion and protection of the rights of the child. More than 1,500 community leaders and other influential people in communities, have been mobilized and committed to children&39;s rights. The use of multimedia approaches made it possible to reach nearly 4,500,000 people on the rights of the child, the consequences of harmful practices, the promotion of peace and social cohesion. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
